result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Michael John Tochalauski is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

This bond replaces all prior bonds in case numbers 15CF81, 15CF96, 16CF139, 16CF161 and 16CF162. This bond is in effect until disposition of the case or until modified by the court.    We are obtaining your social security number for collection purposes per Wis. Stats. 71.935.  Disclosing your social security number to us is considered voluntary on your part. Maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to enter any establishment whose main source of income is from the sale of alcohol with the exception of Legendary Waters Casino for employment purposes.  Maintain employment.  No contact with Rebecca T., Jay G., Daniel H. or Garit P.  Not to possess any firearms/dangerous weapons.    Not to possess or consume any alcohol or drugs, except for medications as prescribed by a physician and taken only as prescribed.  Not to allow anyone else access to prescription medications.  Defendant must check in with the Bayfield County Sheriff's Dept.  every Monday, Wednesday and Friday before 5:00 p.m.  Defendant will be subject to random breath tests and UAs at the discretion of the Department.  If the defendant cannot physically travel to the Sheriff's Department, the Sheriff will perform bail monitoring of the defendant within the community.  This bond covers case numbers 15CF81, 15CF96, 16CF139, 16CF161 and 16CF162.
04-27-2017; Bond condition modified to allow Defendant to travel to the Endeavor, Wisconsin area between April 28, 2017 and May 3, 2017 to visit his daughter. Defendant is to check in with Bayfield County Sheriffs Department on April 28th, 2017 prior to leaving for a UA with the Bayfield Co Jail staff and upon his return on May 3, 2017 after business hours.

records.addlTxt: Demand for Discovery and Inspection submitted by the Defendant's Attorney with cover letter.
Copy of  email correspondence from the public defenders office indicating no attorney has been found for the defendant.

Defendant Michael John Tochalauski with attorney Jesse Johansen, both by v/c from B.C. jail.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing covers 15CF138, 15CF96, 15CF81, 15CF18.
Johansen; wishes for a jury trial, need time to obtain previous counsel's file and investigate.  DA; requests 15CF96 be scheduled first, will need a week for this case.  Jury trial scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael John Tochalauski in court by v/c from B.C. jail with attorney John Charles Bachman in the courtroom.  Frederick Ian Bourg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bachman; client has requested Atty be removed from cases; broken relationship.  Def; have contacted SPD for another Atty.  Court; talks w/ defendant about with the removal of Atty Bachman, the JT set in May will be delayed.  Court; find the Atty/Client relationship has been broken and allows Atty Bachman to withdraw.  JT set in May, 2016 is being removed from the calendar.  Status conference scheduled for April 26, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant appeared by v/c from Bayfield County Jail
